alert.note: Alert for Boone County Except Southwest; Boone County Higher Elevations; Johnson County Higher Elevations; Marion; Newton County Higher Elevations; Newton County Lower Elevations; Northwest Searcy County Higher Elevations; Pope County Higher Elevations; Southern Johnson County; Western and Northern Logan County (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 9:20AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Logan, northwestern Searcy, Newton, Johnson, southwestern Marion and southern Boone Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 920 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Rudd to near Saint Paul to near Chester. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Harrison... Clarksville... Jasper... Lamar... Hartman... Western Grove... Scranton... Pyatt... Valley Springs... Dugger... Olvey... Carver... Erbie... Upper Buffalo Wilderness Area... Devils Knob... Hoyt... Lost Valley State Park... Pruitt... Rosetta... Dillen... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for western, central and north central Arkansas.
